intro: Hieracium variable, commonly known as the variable hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers form dense, flat clusters. It is characterized by its variability in leaf shape and flower size, which contributes to its common name.
